intro: Stachytarpheta rhomboidalis, commonly known as the purpletop vervain, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, making it an important species in local ecosystems.
